description.plain:
Echosmith is an alternative-pop band formed in 2009, which originally consisted of four siblings––Graham, Noah, Jamie, and Sydney Sierota. (Sydney is now a Quiseng, as she is married to Cameron Quiseng of Allstar Weekend). They went from four to three following the departure of Jamie, who decided to take care of his newborn child. Wonder how they got their name?

We were just going through anything we could think of and we went through hundreds of names.
We landed on the idea of a blacksmith shaping metals and somehow we landed on Echosmith, you know, shaping sounds. It had a cool meaning and also it was short, simple, and easy to say, and it wasn’t too genre-specific, either.
- Interview with elle.com

They are best known for their hit single, “Cool Kids”, which reached number 13 on the Billboard Hot 100. Originally released on May 31, 2013 as the iTunes single of the week, it became a sleeper hit and didn’t reach its chart peak until mid-to-late 2014. Their debut album Talking Dreams was released on October 30, 2013, with second single “Come Together” being released on June 12, 2014, and third single “Bright” being released on February 2, 2015.

Recently, though, they came back with a second, more personal album Lonely Generation on January 10, 2020, after releasing the title track with music video “Lonely Generation” on September 27, 2019, and “Shut up and Kiss Me” on November 22, 2019.

body.plain:
Echosmith is an alternative-pop band formed in 2009, which originally consisted of four siblings––Graham, Noah, Jamie, and Sydney Sierota. (Sydney is now a Quiseng, as she is married to Cameron Quiseng of Allstar Weekend). They went from four to three following the departure of Jamie, who decided to take care of his newborn child. Wonder how they got their name?

We were just going through anything we could think of and we went through hundreds of names.
We landed on the idea of a blacksmith shaping metals and somehow we landed on Echosmith, you know, shaping sounds. It had a cool meaning and also it was short, simple, and easy to say, and it wasn’t too genre-specific, either.
- Interview with elle.com

They are best known for their hit single, “Cool Kids”, which reached number 13 on the Billboard Hot 100. Originally released on May 31, 2013 as the iTunes single of the week, it became a sleeper hit and didn’t reach its chart peak until mid-to-late 2014. Their debut album Talking Dreams was released on October 30, 2013, with second single “Come Together” being released on June 12, 2014, and third single “Bright” being released on February 2, 2015.

Recently, though, they came back with a second, more personal album Lonely Generation on January 10, 2020, after releasing the title track with music video “Lonely Generation” on September 27, 2019, and “Shut up and Kiss Me” on November 22, 2019.

songs.title: Cool Kids

description.plain:
This is the first single not only for the album but for the band itself. The song went Platinum in December 2014. Crazy part is that the song was nearly left off of their album.

Jamie (singer/guitarist) says the message of the song is simple: the coolest thing you can be is yourself. But more often than not, fans tell the band that they relate to the kids they’re singing about. That they feel like the outsider looking in.

This cry to be like the cool kids… it’s something that everyone kind of goes through whether you want to act like it or not. There’s always somebody out there that you kind of wish, ‘If only I could do this, or do that.’ I think that’s why it connects with people so well.

He also said to NGEN radio…

I think Cool Kids is definitely a song that people have been connecting with a lot, and I think the song for us is a story about a boy and a girl who want to fit in and they see these kids they think are so cool. In reality the message is if being being yourself is cool, then you don’t have to try to be someone else

When asked about the powerful lyrics, Sydney (lead vocalist) explained:

We didn’t write the song with the intent of, ‘Oh my gosh, I want to write a hit single, and I want people to know our song.’ Obviously you do want that, but when you write, you need to be honest; we wrote this song because we relate to it. Everybody at some point, whether you’re a kid or not, you do have that desire to be like somebody else, and you constantly compare yourself. And it’s an everyday decision to decide not to.

With a cool little story to follow about Katy Perry loving the song too.

I was backstage and she was just walking to her green room and she said, “cool kids, I wish I could be like them” and, like, pointed at me and walked away. I was like, ‘What?!’ and I literally just had my mouth open. I actually told someone, ‘Tell her to come back out and take a picture with me!’

songs.embed_content: Read “Cool Kids” by Echosmith on Genius

67 ContributorsCool Kids Lyrics[Verse 1]
She sees them walking in a straight line, that's not really her style
And they all got the same heartbeat, but hers is falling behind
Nothing in this world could ever bring them down
Yeah, they're invincible, and she's just in the background
And she says

[Chorus]
I wish that I could be like the cool kids
'Cause all the cool kids, they seem to fit in
I wish that I could be like the cool kids
Like the cool kids

[Verse 2]
He sees them talking with a big smile, but they haven't got a clue
Yeah, they're living the good life, can't see what he is going through
They're driving fast cars, but they don't know where they're going
In the fast lane, living life without knowing
And he says

[Chorus]
I wish that I could be like the cool kids

I wish that I could be like the cool kids
Like the cool kids

'Cause all the cool kids, they seem to get it
I wish that I could be like the cool kids
Like the cool kids
You might also like[Bridge]
And they said

[Chorus]
I wish that I could be like the cool kids
'Cause all the cool kids, they seem to fit in
I wish that I could be like the cool kids
Like the cool kids

songs.title: Bright

description.plain:
Bright was released as the third single from Echosmith’s debut album, Talking Dreams, on February 2nd, 2015.

It peaked at 40 in the US, becoming their second top forty hit.

This love song is mostly determined to be between a girl and a guy, but it has also been played on Christian radio stations because it references God’s involvement in the relationship and connects the beauty of love with the beauty of God’s creation.

songs.embed_content: Read “Bright” by Echosmith on Genius

songs.lyrics:
20 ContributorsBright Lyrics[Verse 1]
I think the universe is on my side
Heaven and earth have finally aligned
Days are good and that's the way it should be
You sprinkle stardust on my pillow case
It's like a moonbeam brushed across my face
Nights are good and that's the way it should be

[Pre-Chorus]
You make me sing, "Ooh"
La la la
You make a girl go, "Ooh"
I'm in love, love

[Chorus]
Did you see that shooting star tonight?
Were you dazzled by the same constellation?
Did you and Jupiter conspire to get me?
I think you and the Moon and Neptune got it right
'Cause now I'm shining bright, so bright
Bright, so bright

[Verse 2]
And I see colors in a different way
You make what doesn't matter fade to grey
Life is good and that's the way it should be
You might also like[Pre-Chorus]
You make me sing "ooh"
La la la
You make a girl go "ooh"
I'm in love, love

[Chorus]
Did you see that shooting star tonight?
Were you dazzled by the same constellation?
Did you and Jupiter conspire to get me?
I think you and the Moon and Neptune got it right
'Cause now I'm shining bright, so bright
And I get lost in your eyes

[Chorus]
Did you see that shooting star tonight?
Were you dazzled by the same constellation?
Did you and Jupiter conspire to get me?
I think you and the Moon and Neptune got it right
I think you and the Moon and Neptune got it right
I think you and the Moon and Neptune got it right
'Cause now I'm shining bright, so bright
Bright, so bright
Bright, so bright
And I get lost in your eyes tonight30Embed

songs.title: Over My Head

description.plain:
“Over My Head” is a downtempo pop song chronicling the singer’s frustration over her partner, who is constantly highlighting their knowledge in areas she can’t understand. The song serves as Echosmith’s first single to be released off their upcoming sophomore album, Inside A Dream.

The song’s existence was first revealed on 28 February 2018 through radio information database All Access, stated to impact Top 40 Radio on 20 March 2018. Later that day, the song’s audio was quietly uploaded to iHeart Radio’s website as part of their “Daily Download” segment, despite no promotion or acknowledgement from the band’s media profiles.

songs.embed_content: Read “Over My Head” by Echosmith on Genius

songs.lyrics:
16 ContributorsOver My Head Lyrics[Intro]
Over my head, over my head, over my head
Over my head, over my head, over my head

[Verse 1]
There's only static on TV in this hotel room
Reminds me of all the things you think I don't understand
It seems like you and me, we keep losing connection
Whenever you talk to me, it doesn't make any sense

[Pre-Chorus 1]
Don't know what you meant, it's always over my head
Yeah, over my head
Yeah, it's so

[Chorus]
Over my head, over my head, over my head
Over my head, over my head, over my head
Is it too late, too far gone to fix this?
Over my head, over my head, over my head
Over my head, over my head

[Verse 2]
You take the simplest thing and always complicate it
Talking in circles, got me dizzy like a merry-go-round
It shouldn't be so hard to have a conversation
I'm sick of fighting with your ego, I wish you would admit
You might also like[Pre-Chorus 2]
But I don't understand, it's always over my head
Yeah, over my head
Yeah, it's so

[Chorus]
Over my head, over my head, over my head
Over my head, over my head, over my head
Is it too late, too far gone to fix this?
Over my head, over my head, over my head
Over my head, over my head

[Bridge]
So tell me, tell me
Tell me all the things that you are thinking, thinking
Tell me what it is that I am missing, missing
Don't want this to slip right through our hands
Don't want this to go
Over my head, over my head, over my head
Over my head, over my head, over my head
Is it too late, too far gone to fix this?
Over my head, over my head, over my head

[Chorus]
Over my head, over my head, over my head
Over my head, over my head, over my head
Is it too late, too far gone to fix this?
Over my head, over my head, over my head
Oh, over my head
Over my head
